replies.body: Goodbye Twisted Treeline :(

Next year:
Summoners Rift is officially retiring with 10.24. We've come to this decision in order of having more stable TFT servers.
Also here's some prestige TFT pets.
{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
- Riot

I never played much treeline or really cared much about the game mode, but I do agree that a more significant consolation package would have probably been better than two icons and an emote, such as an exclusive skin, I don't know, I just know that the dedicated players to that game mode should be held in high enough regards at riot because they are just as much a part of the fan base as SR members, to have something like an exclusive skin or even just a chroma(perfect for an ivern skin idea?).
Yo you should definitely care, because once TTL goes away all those bots come to SR

Ya it's pretty sad. That was actually a good game mode. And it was great when you had a group of friends and wanted to play AGAINST each other. It's pretty tough to assemble 10 people. 6 is a whole lot easier.
The war against mana regen continues. Supports have a harder time finding quality mana items as it is. The regen from the spell-theif made a pretty big difference. Don't like it one bit.
I dislike it too. Think we're gonna have to just build tear and deal with the constant "Nami - Tear of the Godess" "???" pings.
Spend that extra 1400g on regen that you would've spent on Coin upgrades!  Problem solved!

Except that supports now lose our main source of gold after lane phase so you can spend that "extra 1400g on regen that you would've spent on Coin upgrades" but after that you can't get gold for shit.
Basically for supports the game is now all about who can do the most with 1500g in the early-mid game as scaling really isn't much of an option anymore.
except you still get gold after tier 3 so what are you smoking?

Only from Gp10 which comes to a grand total of a whopping 180 gold every 10 minutes, when you hit tier 3 you lose the gold making passive that provides the majority of a support's income. 180 gold every 10 minutes is negligible at best.
What the hell are you smoking?

Amen! Like I play as Sona and Nami and even Biscuit Delivery isn’t a proper solution to our Mana issue. 

Then they go ahead and take out both, Mana Regeneration and Cooldown Reduction from Spellthief’s which is like WHET :-/ 

The only reason I’m incentivised to play aggressive with that item and complete my quest in 10-12 minutes (depending on who I’m up against) is so I can get that Regeneration and CDR buff. 

+ now they want us to make 1,000 gold instead of 500. The latter was also a pain in the ass if you ask me but now this is just worse. 

Then you have the whole thing about ‘Poaching Penalty’ which is like..... pretty sure the person who came up with this one was an ADC whose Support kept taking his/her CS and was mad about it. 

So hard so slow push now/ get my CS when ADC isn’t around or whatever! -_-
F for Ohmwrecker

This post is more for me coming to terms with twisted treeline's removal, so please disregard it. I have loved playing both Co-op vs Ai on Twisted Treeline and pvp on it for the last 5 years about one game every day or so until the announcement of its removal. It is pretty depressing for me to be leaving especially with the stresses of regular life getting heavier the last few weeks. I likely won't return to this page anyway, I just need to type this out to let myself accept and move on.

"With Twisted Treeline being removed in 'tonight's' patch, that likely means its the last day for me on this game as well. This game was a great way for me to destress at the end of the day, and have a good time with some close family 
 and friends. Thank you League of Legends for the many fun years. Hopefully with twisted treeline's removal you can bring more joy to those that play summoners rift and teamfight tactics. I will truly miss this game. To all who read this, good luck in your future endeavors and I hope you all have a lot of fun with the new season. I hope one day to comeback to this game, or that somehow the new changes make me change my mind about summoners rift so I don't end up leaving, but in the likelihood that it doesn't, thanks for the fun years and see you all in the future."

So I am totally on board with you, I'm bummed TT is leaving.  At the same time though, you really shouldn't be misleading with this kind of thing.  According to Mobalytics you have only played 10 games of Twisted Treeline over the last 6 months, compared to the 60 games of ARAM over the same time period.  You also didn't play a single game of Twisted Treeline from 6 months ago to at least 8 months ago, just nothing but ARAM (I am an ARAM lover as well).

I am just as bummed about Twisted Treeline being removed, but let's be honest, yes?
A lot of people have been waiting on the promised fix of the bots issue and then Riot decided to just remove it instead.
So nothing for supports that want to start mana or cdr? Another screw you to enchanters?

Exactly. Like I main Nami and Sona and they NEED Mana Regeneration + CDR early game and that’s what the Eye helps with. 

So it’s like wtf Riot because first of all you play aggressively to complete the quest and AGGRESSIVE = MANA USE and now there’s no CDR/Mana Regen and less coin from hitting enemies with Spellthief’s so overall, the process of completing the quest(s) will be longer and more frustrating. 

And biscuit delivery doesn’t do s**t so it’s like :-/

Especially since it now seems like there is no way to get to the CDR cap as an enchanter. We REALLY need CDR, but if the game ends when we have two items, that's 20% + 10% from transcendence and whatever from the CDR rune because we won't be level 18. And that's if you even get far enough for transcendence to happen and to get two full items. We really needed that CDR. Unlike everyone else, supports don't have a 20% CDR item to rush, because we had 10% there.

Riot just doesn't like Enchanters. They think its because they do too much damage but in reality its because they've taken everything BUT the damage from nearly every enchanter. Just look at Yuumi, she's a good example except for her it happened really fast. They get rid of all the utility a champ has, leave only the dmg, surprise pikachu face when the champs start building for dmg and then call the class troublesome when in reality, any REAL enchanter player doesnt care about the dmg. Nerf the dmg if the utility is too good, don't leave a class with nothing but dmg and then call it an issue.
The way they figure, Enchanters can now rush Mana Regen Items like {{item:3070}} or {{item:3114}} earlier now that you can just buy the support item & sit on it.

I thought of that, but a {{item:3114}} by itself doesn't actually do much to help mana problems. It's not like the 50% by itself solved mana problems, but it did help solve mana issues with other mana regen items.

For early game mana, I will more often than not be buying {{item:1082}} now.

You lose out on initial laning stats, but get into your other items MUCH faster between the free upgrades and more gold per proc.
It's a fair trade-off for being so accelerated into our builds IMO.
To a cap though, right? So it benefits whoever wants to get their first item fastest, really. I don't feel like {{item:3174}} is like a super hard spike or anything.

Athene's is great! I try to work it into all of my enchanter builds. The greatest part about it imo is that you can rush {{item:3108}} if you're ahead or {{item:3028}} if you're behind, gaining aggressive/defensive stats respectively. I can feel the difference when I pick it up on Rakan, Ivern, or Bard but those are the only enchanters that I've played a lot of this season.

It's also pretty good on Senna from what I've experimented >.>
I'm not gonna lie though, I'll miss the mana regen before first back. It will force recalls a little bit earlier for a lot of supports.

Yeah, but it also loses effectiveness with the mana regen being taken off the support item. And buying {{item:3028}} will be a worse general defensive option because you'll be seeing AD champs at support more. And if you're an enchanter, you don't really have a good option for armor.

Please make a list of link to an article in the notes which shows which items will be available for the essence emporium this time around! Its a bit difficult to track them and If there's no article for it on its own at least put a link towards a list of items! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

excuse me WHAT? Cloud drake needs to be seriously looked at. Ult cooldown reduced by 40% EXCEEDING the 40% CDR cap is super busted! a potential of 85% CDR reduction on ultimate abilities is ridiculous, Bringing URF ultimates to summoners rift is not the way to go. This is probably one of the most potentially broken things I've heard about in my 4 years of playing. Riot, just  find something else to change cloud drake to.
I don't know if they took into account Ultimate Hunter and Cosmic Insight. With those 2 Ultimate CDR is already at 70%...

Currently, you can get 25% ultimate CDR + 45% CDR. They do not add up to 70% CDR. Instead, your ultimate cooldown is multipled by .55 (because of your CDR), then it is multiplied by .75 (because of your ultimate CDR). Right now, this makes your ultimate's cooldown 41.25% of its base cooldown. That's 58.75% CDR.

With 4 cloud drakes next patch, you could have 65% ultimate CDR + 45% CDR. Your ultimate cooldown would be multipled by .55 (because of your CDR) then multiplied by .35 (because of your ultimate CDR). That would make your ultimate's cooldown 19.25% of its base cooldown. That's 80.75% CDR.
That would make Lux's ult have a 7.7 second cd. lmfao

I very much doubt they'd calculate it in the way you're thinking of. It's probably done separately or soft-capped. 

So for example, you've got a 100 sec ult, 40% cdr and 40% ult cdr.

Its probably a 60 second ult (cause 40% ult cdr) x 40% cdr. NOT 40% ult cdr + 40%cdr = 80% cdr. That 10 second ult turns into 36 second cooldown btw. Much higher than the 20 you're thinking of. Ultimate hunter and the last 5% cdr won't bring it below 30s I believe. 

still pretty op, but cmon you let them get 4 cloud drakes, what do you expect right? Also, they'll probably be better off building other items not with cooldown reduction just because that's more efficient.
I don't wanna play ADC anymore... Tired of getting one-shot all the time every game. ADC is the worst role in the game right now, open your eyes.
Excuse me sir, but literally every toplaner for the last three or more years would like a word with you about "the worst role in the game right now".
Toplane was so bad I left for jungle
Not sure why anyone would even bother building spellthiefs anymore, now that there is no mana regen. May as well just take the tank option that gives ap, more useful stats for your time.
With a 400 gold, one time purchase for support item, buy a mana item second. problem solved.
I mean, I play nami support regularly, and I build nothing but mana items and boots. No mana and no proc'd damage means the item is way weaker at every stage now.
I don't even know how to comment on the support item changes; and I don't mean that in a good way. I honestly can't even find the words on where to start.

Thank you for giving Nami love by having her DIE XD in the patch video but I’m sorry being a support main who plays champions like Nami and Sona who are heavily reliant on mana, especially in the laning phase, removing Mana regeneration from Spellthief’s Edge is the stupidest thing in the world. 

First, you now want us to get 1,500 gold overall to upgrade our Support Items instead for 500 and then don’t even give Mana Regeneration. 

Like it’s so frustrating to play super aggressive and die sometimes to make that 500 gold and now you even reduce how much gold we earn from attacking champions/ buildings. 

Playing aggressive = Exhausting Mana. DUH! So without mana regeneration, I won’t be able to complete my first quest in 10-15 minutes (depending on who I’m up against) and therefore, will not be able to impact the map overall by being able to place more wards because I’ll need to build a Tear and what not to get than mana flow coming. 

+ no CDR for Eye of the Frost and the final one is another horrible thing to do. It’s hard to get 40% CDR quick and this upgrade helps achieve that in the first 15 minutes. 

That’s 10% CDR + high Mana Regeneration was the reason people were incentivised to play aggressively and get the quest done, even if it meant putting your life on the line. And now you take it out like it’s nobody’s business. 

Then there’s the entire thing about penalty for Support players to not farm. Like are you serious? 

At times we need to clear waves and slow push them since we (atleast I do) generally build Boots of Mobility and can switch lanes fast and rejoin the team fight or when the ADC is back at the base or dead, there’s nothing wrong with me getting my CS. 

I don’t know but these updates are an attack against all Support Mains in so many ways it’s not even funny. It’s like we are made to feel grateful that we get to save the 1,200 gold from not upgrading items but then you have so many terms and conditions for that it’s like frustrating. 

S M H -_-

> [{quoted}](name=AroushTheKween,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=Zuz4QPyX,comment-id=0030,timestamp=2019-11-19T21:18:05.160+0000)
>
> S M H -_-

Don't forget they also removed the on-hit damage from Spellthief as well.  This was a HUGE part its power as well, far more so than the pitiful AP it gives.  Enchanters don't even have good AP scaling, Spellthief is now a dead item-line.

Why would you remove tribute and spoils of war from the completed support items????
That's seriously going to suck, that's our main gold production; we're now going to reach our first item and then become useless or have to steal CS.
And then there’s a Penalty against ‘poaching’ so taking CS isn’t an option either! :-/

Is it just me or do the new support items just seem absolutely dog rn like enchanters don't get mana Regen and tanks don't get health Regen plus on top of losing both of those now we finish are item and can't get gold anymore cause passive is removed? Like at least help us out and make it like 5 gold per 10 seconds if your not gonna let us get anything from creeps. Season 10 already looking like it's bout to suck

Also —

goodbye, Twisted Treeline. I will never agree with how you were treated by Riot as a mode, and I will look forward to seeing you again when (and if) we get Hexakill as a RGM.

I'm not excited for this.

While rare, the idea that you can get an additional 40% cdr from cloud drakes is downright insane. And 20% execution thresh hold from elder drake makes outplays at low health even less tangible. I hate how the game is being streamlined to win or lose faster. And with treeline's removal I'm basically forced to deal with this terrible RNG that I don't have power over and won't know in select. It seems like more and more skill is being traded for coin flip. Lowering botlane's individual agency by nerfs to supports AND their ability to level up through waves AND making the dragons decide the fate of the entire game? In what world will that not mean " four bot, gank until they can't stand".

Please, reassess these numbers at the very least. Let me play strategically.

so I dont understand there "anti-poaching" note. it says ,"Farming more than 20 CS per 5 minutes (3 out of 10 waves) reduces gold from minions by 50%. The penalty increases with further CS to a max of 80% reduction at 50 minions." Does that mean if you farm well you get punished? 10 cs per min is good cs'ing as far as i know.
If you have a support item, you will now get punished for CS'ing, i assume.

before when you used to cs with a support item, with anything but a targons passive, the item would become disabled so this is actually a buff for supports who can now occasionally farm while still keeping their item active while also making sure people just dont take the item into a solo lane for more gold.
